roleset.name: banks purchasing longer term assets to keep inflation up

roles.note: Also called "quantitative easing", or "QE" for short. "QE1", "QE2", "QE3" and "QE-infinity" refer to specific instances of quantitative easing that began in the US on certain dates.

role.descr: agent, monetary authority responsible for QE

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT-5.

example.name: argM
example.text: Inflation fell from 5.0 % to 4.8 % and the economy is still very poor so the road is open for more easing .

example.name: more argMs
example.text: Hello all . So there are rumors of further quantitative easing in the works .

example.name: arg1
example.text: The Federal Reserve announced on November 3, 2010, a second round of quantitative easing of $600 billion.

example.name: arg0
example.text: With US quantitative easing off the table for the time being, bullion remains below the $1600 level and continues to fight a bullish dollar.
